stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Stronghold Bailey
stadium.description: The team plays in the central bailey of Stronghold Castle, a massive fortress built on a plateau overlooking the city. The field is packed earth and cobblestone, and the crowd watches from the surrounding stone ramparts.

stats.pregame_ritual: Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Searching for a four-leaf clover near the sidelines.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Sharing a piece of fermented fish with a teammate.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Tying a red string around their pinky finger.

preGame:
# üèüÔ∏è TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL: THE WINNERS BRACKET BRAWL! üèüÔ∏è

Well, hello there, sports fans and blood-thirsty enthusiasts! This is your favorite devil-may-care demon, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the leafy, trap-filled confines of **Fletchings Field**! We are kicking off the Winners Bracket in this spectacular Best of 3 series, and the atmosphere here in Fletchings is absolutely electric! The local druids have been busy twisting the roots and shifting the terrain, making sure the pitch is just as unpredictable as a warlock's mood swings! 

On my left, we have the **New Ravenfall Commanders**! These folks are practically royalty‚Äîor at least they hang around it enough to smell like expensive perfume and old parchment. I saw Hooge Imtiaz leading the team in that bone-chilling synchronized chant; it starts as a whisper and ends like a thunderclap that makes your teeth rattle! And look at Estes Adrian over there, snackin' on honeycomb like he‚Äôs already won the prize! He better hope that sugar rush lasts once the hammers start swinging!

And on my right, the hometown favorites, **Oak & Onslaught**! They‚Äôve got the backing of the Wardens, including that ranger with the fancy bow, Sir Randy‚Äîthough I doubt a bow will do much good when a Trollhead is flying at your face! Teria Ravo is already headbutting her own goal post just to get the blood flowing, and Normi Glaudia has his boots on the wrong feet for luck! It‚Äôs a madhouse, folks, and I love every minute of it! Both these teams are top-tier in the popularity polls, so the ramparts are packed with screaming fans ready to see some glorious, sanctioned violence! Let's get to the carnage! üõ°Ô∏èü™ì
postGame:
# üèÜ OAK & ONSLAUGHT TAKES GAME ONE IN A CRUNCHING FINALE! üèÜ

Holy smokes, what a game! If you like your sports with a side of heavy-duty medical attention, tonight was your Christmas, New Year, and Birthday all rolled into one! The Oak & Onslaught crew defended their turf at Fletchings Field with a 3-2 victory that left the Commanders looking like they‚Äôd been through a meat grinder! It was a seesaw of pain and points from the opening whistle!

The Commanders started strong when Croteau Osmo scooped up that leather troll head in center field like it was a bag of gold coins. But the violence started early! Estes Adrian of the Commanders absolutely flattened Symer Crissy, sending the first of many players to the healer‚Äôs tent. It looked like Ravenfall had the upper hand when Moir Sass lined up a beautiful shot from the Home Field and sunk it for two points! A classic display of skill, even if they do hang out with that celebrity Artorias a bit too much for my liking.

But don't you count out the home team! Milt Casady decided he‚Äôd had enough of Croteau Osmo‚Äôs shenanigans and delivered a tackle that probably echoed all the way to the Demon Prison! From there, it was a total breakdown of civility. Normi Glaudia and Teria Ravo went on a rampage, injuring Dusa Curson, Estes Adrian, and Rhett Gavrilla in quick succession. By the time the halftime whistle blew, the field looked more like a battlefield in the Everwar than a sports pitch!

Halftime gave everyone a chance to breathe, and for Hooge Imtiaz to work some magic, but the second half was just as brutal! Croteau Osmo came back with a vengeance, knocking Millham Evangeline right out of their boots. The Commanders were trying to claw back, but the shifting terrain of Fletchings Field seemed to favor the Wardens' pets today. Every time Ravenfall tried to make a move, a root or a gully seemed to trip 'em up!

Then came the turning point! After a flurry of hits that saw Abner Seidel and Theis Loredo carried off, Teria Ravo found an opening. She didn't just run; she charged like a possessed bull right into the End Zone and dunked that troll head home! The crowd went absolutely bananas! You could hear the cheers over the sound of snapping bones, and that‚Äôs saying something!

But the Commanders weren't done! Croteau Osmo, showing more grit than a mouthful of graveyard dirt, managed to injure Wynnie Faina to keep the pressure on. It was a desperate scramble in the closing minutes, with the ball changing hands faster than a bribe in a merchant's guild. The Commanders were looking for that one miracle play to tie it up or take the lead.

However, the hero of the hour was Milt Casady! Positioned right in the center field, with chaos swirling around him like a magical storm, he took a breath and let it fly! The troll head sailed through the air, past the reaching fingers of the Commanders' defense, and through the goal for a two-point stunner! Talk about a dagger to the heart of Ravenfall!

I have to say, seeing the Commanders fall short despite their 'heroic' connections really warms my cold, dark heart. Maybe they should spend less time reciting epic poems and more time practicing their aim! Sir Randy and his Warden friends are going to be celebrating tonight, probably with some of that high-shelf ale that Falric can't afford. It‚Äôs a tough break for the Commanders, who now find themselves down 1-0 in this Best of 3 series.

If they want to avoid being sent to the Losers Bracket, the Commanders are going to need to find a way to stop Milt Casady and Teria Ravo. Those two were like a two-person wrecking crew out there! And don't forget Affra Yanaton, who capped off the game by sending Fleme Alis to the sidelines with a crunching blow right at the buzzer. Just pure, unadulterated Trollball at its finest!

Final Score: **Oak & Onslaught 3, New Ravenfall Commanders 2**. What a way to start the playoffs! Join us next time for Game 2, where the Commanders will be fighting for their lives‚Äîliterally! This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that in Trollball, if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying hard enough! Goodnight, Osterra! üíÄüèüÔ∏èüî•
